definition: weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
disadvantaged social groups (e.g. the handicapped)/the economically and politically marginalized/the dispossessed

sentences.english: As a next-exporter of goods, China has benefited from a weak dollar.
sentences.chinese: 作为加工出口导向的国家，中国从弱势美元中获益。

sentences.english: So native English speakers will be handicapped.
sentences.chinese: 所以英语本族语言者将会处于弱势。

sentences.english: Volunteer work does not have to focus only on helping the poor and disadvantaged.
sentences.chinese: 志愿工作并非仅仅局限在帮助贫困的弱势群体上。

sentences.english: Preservation of dialect regions and minority languages.
sentences.chinese: 方言区和弱势语言区的保护。

sentences.english: There is a special focus on reaching vulnerable or hard-to-reach population groups.
sentences.chinese: 特别重点为普及到弱势或难以接触到的人群组。

sentences.english: Averages high-grade bending back pressure heavy structures are vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 均线高档下弯反压沉重，结构甚为弱势。

sentences.english: He led his vulnerable army to Xiangyang and Wuchang, Hubei Province.
sentences.chinese: 他带领他的弱势军襄阳与武昌，湖北。

sentences.english: "Me-too" businesses have a tough time making a mark, especially during a weak economy.
sentences.chinese: 我一样‘企业要产生影响尤其在弱势经济下很难。

sentences.english: That helping disadvantaged groups is the indispensable duty of WEIKAQI.
sentences.chinese: 帮助弱势群体维咔奇责无旁贷。

sentences.english: However, a weakness of relational databases is in storing documents with a semi-structured nature.
sentences.chinese: 但是，关系数据库的弱势在于存储半结构化文档方面。

sentences.english: The worker's often have no ways to ask for help Because of their relatively weak.
sentences.chinese: 囿于个体劳动者的相对弱势，劳动者常常求助无门。

sentences.english: Switzerland also sees itself as a victim of the weak euro and dollar.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士也认为自己是弱势欧元和美元的受害者。

sentences.english: They will turn on us at the first sign of weakness.
sentences.chinese: 一有弱势，他们就会反咬一口。

sentences.english: Development policies targetting vulnerable groups, particularly women, are needed.
sentences.chinese: 面对目标弱势人群实施一些政策，特别是女人。

sentences.english: The weak dollar policy will end up in disaster, in my opinion.
sentences.chinese: 依我之见，弱势美元政策将以灾难而告终。

sentences.english: It is also one of India's most economically and politically disadvantaged minorities.
sentences.chinese: 他们也是印度国内经济和政治上最为弱势的少数民族。

definition: to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
high position/eminent status/top job/raised position/upper (limbs)/a high (i.e. local maximum)/high point on scale, high grade, temperature, latitude etc
many-headed/many-layered (authority)/devolved (as opposed to centralized)/pluralistic/(as classifier) number of animals/long term (finance)/long (investment)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
bull market (prices appear to be rising)
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
